keyMoments.title: Yoko Introduced as Little East Blue Protector
keyMoments.description: Yoko is introduced as a young girl wearing a Marine cape who protects Little East Blue alongside Boss the beetle. She initially distrusts the Straw Hat Pirates.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Yoko as a key supporting character for the Little East Blue arc.

keyMoments.title: Yoko's Tragic Past Revealed
keyMoments.description: Yoko's backstory is revealed: her father Ryudo was a Marine who defended Little East Blue alone and was killed by pirates five years ago. She took up his mantle, wearing his uniform and protecting the island.
keyMoments.significance: Explains Yoko's anti-pirate sentiment and her role as the island's protector.

relationships.description: Yoko is the daughter of Ryudo, a Marine who died defending Little East Blue from pirates five years before the arc.

evolutionMoments.description: Yoko's relationship with her deceased father is revealed, explaining why she wears his Marine uniform.

relationships.description: Yoko befriended Boss the beetle three years ago after finding him in the forest. Boss's strength reminds her of her father.

evolutionMoments.description: Yoko's bond with Boss is explained, revealing she sees her father's strength in the beetle.

reveals.information: Father Ryudo was a Marine killed by pirates five years ago
Protects Little East Blue in her father's memory, wearing his Marine uniform
Initially distrusts all pirates due to her father's death

keyMoments.title: Ryudo's Sacrifice Revealed
keyMoments.description: Ryudo is revealed to have been Yoko's father, a Marine who defended Little East Blue alone and died fighting pirates five years before the current events.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the tragic backstory that motivates Yoko's character.

statusHistory.reason: Killed by pirates while defending Little East Blue five years before episode 427

relationships.description: Ryudo is Yoko's father who died defending Little East Blue.

evolutionMoments.description: Ryudo's death and his relationship to Yoko is revealed.

reveals.information: Died defending Little East Blue from pirates

keyMoments.title: Mendo Introduced
keyMoments.description: Mendo is introduced as one of the main residents of Little East Blue, working as a teacher on the island.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes one of the supporting characters for the Little East Blue arc.

reveals.information: Works as a teacher on Little East Blue

keyMoments.title: Luigia Introduced
keyMoments.description: Luigia is introduced as one of the main residents of Little East Blue, an elderly woman who lives on the island.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes one of the supporting characters for the Little East Blue arc.

keyMoments.title: Mitsuboshi Introduced
keyMoments.description: Mitsuboshi is introduced as one of the main residents of Little East Blue, working as a cook on the island.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes one of the supporting characters for the Little East Blue arc.

reveals.information: Works as a cook on Little East Blue

keyMoments.title: Boss the Beetle Appears
keyMoments.description: Boss, a giant horned beetle with a Marine insignia on his shell, is introduced as the protector of Little East Blue who was befriended by Yoko.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the central creature around which the arc's conflict revolves.

relationships.description: Boss was befriended by Yoko three years ago. She sees her father's strength in him.

evolutionMoments.description: Boss's bond with Yoko is revealed.

reveals.information: Created by Dr. Indigo for Shiki's plan to destroy East Blue but escaped
Large horned beetle with Marine insignia painted on shell by Yoko
Protects Little East Blue alongside Yoko

keyMoments.title: Largo and the Amigo Pirates Surface
keyMoments.description: Largo arrives at Little East Blue with his crew aboard their submarine, seeking to capture Boss the beetle.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the main antagonist of the Little East Blue arc.

keyMoments.title: Largo Reveals Ami Ami no Mi Powers
keyMoments.description: Largo demonstrates the power of the Ami Ami no Mi, showing he can produce sticky nets and create specialized nets by consuming materials.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of the anime-original Ami Ami no Mi Devil Fruit.
keyMoments.quote: With these nets, I have a 120% capture rate!

abilities.description: Largo produces sticky web-like nets at an opponent. This is the most basic type of net from the Ami Ami no Mi.
Largo eats metal, then fires it from his hands as a barbed wire net.

relationships.description: Largo is Corto's brother and the captain of the Amigo Pirates.

evolutionMoments.description: Largo and Corto are revealed to be brothers working together.

reveals.information: Ate the Ami Ami no Mi (Net-Net Fruit), allowing him to produce nets
Seeks to capture Boss the beetle for Shiki

keyMoments.title: Corto and the Amigo Pirates Surface
keyMoments.description: Corto arrives at Little East Blue with the Amigo Pirates, co-leading the assault alongside his brother Largo.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces a secondary antagonist of the Little East Blue arc.

keyMoments.title: Corto Attacks Little East Blue
keyMoments.description: Corto leads the initial assault on Little East Blue, destroying buildings and demanding the villagers hand over Boss.
keyMoments.significance: Escalates the conflict and forces Luffy to intervene.

relationships.description: Corto is Largo's brother and serves under him in the Amigo Pirates.

evolutionMoments.description: Corto and Largo are revealed to be brothers.

reveals.information: Has Devil Fruit powers (nature not yet fully revealed)
